words_data.definition: To provide lodging or sufficient space for someone or something.
To examine something in detail to discover its meaning or structure.
A reason or set of reasons given to persuade others, or an angry disagreement.
Able to speak two languages fluently.
A group of people appointed for a specific function or task.
An inner feeling or voice that guides you to know right from wrong.
Very brave; not deterred by danger or pain.
The expression of disapproval of someone or something based on perceived faults.
A person, plant, or animal that is descended from a particular ancestor.
A serious, unexpected, and often dangerous situation requiring immediate action.
To represent something as being larger, greater, better, or worse than it really is.
Extremely interesting or captivating.
A formal promise or assurance that certain conditions will be fulfilled.
Causing lighthearted laughter and amusement; funny.
The fact of being who or what a person or thing is.
To explain or make something clear by using examples, charts, or pictures.
Personal ornaments, such as necklaces, rings, or bracelets.
A room or building equipped for scientific experiments, research, or teaching.
An official document giving you permission to own, do, or use something.
Written works, especially those considered to have artistic merit, like novels or poetry.
A legal agreement in which a person borrows money to buy property, like a house.
Easily seen or noticed; clear or apparent.
A particular time or instance of an event, often a special one.
Someone who competes against or fights another in a contest, game, or argument.
Lasting or intended to last or remain unchanged forever.
To convince someone to do or believe something through reasoning or argument.
A set of printed or written questions with a choice of answers, used for a survey.
A suggestion or proposal as to the best course of action.
A place where people pay to sit and eat meals that are cooked and served on the premises.
A strong, regular, repeated pattern of movement or sound.
A person employed in an office to assist with correspondence and administrative tasks.
Great or important enough to be worthy of attention.
A student in the second year of high school or college.
The degree or intensity of heat present in a substance or object.
The ability to accept behavior and beliefs that are different from your own.
A sporting competition in which contestants play a series of games to decide the winner.
A decision or vote held or carried by everyone involved; fully in agreement.
The quality or state of being different or diverse; a number of different things.
A machine, usually with wheels and an engine, used for transporting people or goods.
A character whose evil actions or motives are important to the plot of a story.
To shorten a word, phrase, or text.
The science or practice of farming, including growing crops and raising animals.
A person who engages in a pursuit on an unpaid basis, rather than as a professional.
An event causing great and often sudden damage or suffering; a disaster.
A structure found inside the nucleus of a cell that carries genetic information.
The enclosing boundary of a curved geometric figure, especially a circle.
The activity or condition of competing against others.
A word used to connect clauses or sentences, or to coordinate words in the same clause.
The process of developing or being developed; growth or progress.
A simplified drawing showing the appearance, structure, or workings of something.
The practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behavior.
An obscuring of the light from one celestial body by the passage of another.
A book or set of books giving information on many subjects or on many aspects of one subject.
The surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates.
Equal in value, amount, function, or meaning.
A short journey or trip, especially one engaged in as a leisure activity.
The governing body of a nation, state, or community.
The elected executive head of a state in the US.
Risky or dangerous.
To pause before saying or doing something, especially through uncertainty.
A person who comes to live permanently in a foreign country.
An intervening time or space; a pause or break in activity.
The official power to make legal decisions and judgments.
A school or class that prepares children, usually five-year-olds, for first grade.
Impressively beautiful, elaborate, or extravagant; striking.
The process of maintaining or preserving someone or something, or the state of being maintained.
A book, document, or piece of music written by hand rather than typed or printed.
The fact of being required or indispensable.
A group of instrumentalists, especially one combining string, woodwind, brass, and percussion sections.
A small booklet or leaflet containing information or arguments about a single subject.
Relating to the body as opposed to the mind.
A special right, advantage, or immunity granted or available only to a particular person or group.
A plane figure with four straight sides and four right angles, especially one with unequal adjacent sides.
A practice or trial performance of a play or other work for later public performance.
An artificial body placed in orbit around the earth or moon or another planet in order to collect information or for communication.
Critical observation or examination.
The dark shape and outline of someone or something visible against a lighter background.
A way of carrying out a particular task, especially the execution or performance of an artistic work or a scientific procedure.
A person who has had long experience in a particular field, especially military service.
A written guarantee, issued to the purchaser of an article by its manufacturer, promising to repair or replace it if necessary.
The process or action by which one thing absorbs or is absorbed by another.
A thing which can be added to something else in order to make it more useful, versatile, or attractive.
The properties or qualities of a room or building that determine how sound is transmitted in it.
A person's knowledge or experience of something, or a person one knows slightly.
The period following the onset of puberty during which a young person develops from a child into an adult.
A written statement confirmed by oath or affirmation, for use as evidence in court.
Arrangement in a straight line, or in correct or appropriate relative positions.
Relating to or denoting substances that prevent the growth of disease-causing microorganisms.
The technical equipment or machinery needed for a particular activity or purpose.
The art or practice of designing and constructing buildings.
The evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something.
The state of being completely lacking in a particular quality or value, often related to being unable to pay outstanding debts.
A wide street in a town or city, typically one lined with trees.
A system of government in which most of the important decisions are made by state officials rather than by elected representatives.
Something used for making mathematical calculations, in particular a small electronic device with a keyboard and a visual display.
A person who applies for a job or is nominated for election.
An animal that feeds on flesh.
A quiescent insect pupa, especially of a butterfly or moth.
The enclosing boundary of a curved geometric figure, especially a circle.
An alliance for combined action, especially a temporary alliance of political parties forming a government or of states.
Something pledged as security for repayment of a loan, to be forfeited in the event of a default.
Able to catch fire and burn easily.
An expression of opinions or offering of explanations about an event or situation.
Sympathetic pity and concern for the sufferings or misfortunes of others.
Something, typically money, awarded to someone as a recompense for loss, injury, or suffering.
A person who takes part in a sporting contest or a commercial entity engaging in the same business as another.
The action or power of focusing one's attention or mental effort.
A building or complex of buildings containing a number of individually owned apartments or houses.
The action of confirming something or the state of being confirmed.
A result or effect of an action or condition.
A body of fundamental principles or established precedents according to which a state or other organization is acknowledged to be governed.
(Of a disease) spread from one person or organism to another by direct or indirect contact.
A company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity and recognized as such in law.
A person trained to give guidance on personal, social, or psychological problems.
A lack or shortage of something.
The action or process of demolishing or being demolished, often a building.
The number below the line in a common fraction; a divisor.
The action of deposing someone, especially a monarch, or a formal, usually written, statement to be used as evidence.
(Of a place) deserted of people and in a state of bleak and dismal emptiness.
To become progressively worse.
To destroy or ruin completely.
A muscular partition separating the thorax from the abdomen.
An illogical or surprising lack of compatibility between facts.
A person's inherent qualities of mind and character.
A difference or contrast between similar things.
The state or quality of being efficient; achieving maximum productivity.
The state of having the right to do or obtain something.
Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
The act of leaving one's own country to settle permanently in another.
Special importance, value, or prominence given to something.
A person who organizes and operates a business, taking on financial risks.
A state in which opposing forces or influences are balanced.
Equal in value, amount, function, or meaning.
The action of evacuating a person or a place.
A statement that represents something as better or worse than it really is.
Unusually good; outstanding.
Having the power to put plans, actions, or laws into effect.
A public display of works of art or items of interest.
The state of thinking or hoping that something will happen.
Lacking restraint in spending money or using resources.
A person who holds extreme political or religious views.
The action or process of manufacturing or inventing something false.
Close acquaintance with or knowledge of something.
The chemical breakdown of a substance by bacteria, yeasts, or other microorganisms.
Having or showing fluorescence; vividly colorful.
The action of forming or process of being formed.
Inspiring fear or respect through being impressively large or powerful.
A person who establishes an institution or settlement.
A system of millions or billions of stars, together with gas and dust.
A machine for converting mechanical energy into electricity.
A man trained to fight with weapons against other men or wild animals in ancient Rome.
Splendor and impressiveness, especially of appearance or style.
A real or imagined wrong or other cause for complaint or protest.
Conferred by or based on inheritance.
A system in which people or groups are ranked according to status or authority.
Of the same kind; alike.
A colorless, odorless, highly flammable gas, the chemical element of atomic number 1.
The practice of claiming to have moral standards to which one's own behavior does not conform.
A supposition or proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence.
To light up or clarify.
A picture illustrating a book, newspaper, or magazine.
Visually descriptive or figurative language.
The action of using someone or something as a model.
A person who comes to live permanently in a foreign country.
Treating all rivals or disputants equally; fair and just.
To put into effect; a tool or piece of equipment.
The conclusion that can be drawn from something, although it is not explicitly stated.
An idea, feeling, or opinion about something or someone.
Not alive, especially not in the manner of animals and humans.
The formal admission of someone to office.
A thing that motivates or encourages one to do something.
The occurrence, rate, or frequency of a disease, crime, or something else undesirable.
Lasting for an unknown or unstated length of time.
A formal charge or accusation of a serious crime.
Originating or occurring naturally in a particular place; native.
A thing that persuades or influences someone to do something.
Certain to happen; unavoidable.
Soldiers marching or fighting on foot.
A localized physical condition in which part of the body becomes reddened, swollen, hot, and often painful.
Having great influence on someone or something.
Clever, original, and inventive.
Any of the foods or substances that are combined to make a particular dish.
A person or animal that lives in or occupies a place.
A thing that is inherited.
The state, quality, or fact of being innocent of a crime or offense.
The action or process of innovating; a new method, idea, or product.
The action of immunizing someone against a disease; vaccination.
Words inscribed, as on a monument or in a book.
Habitual sleeplessness; inability to sleep.
Careful examination or scrutiny.
Relating to or prompted by instinct; apparently unconscious or automatic.
A society or organization having a particular object or common factor.
A practice or arrangement by which a company provides a guarantee of compensation for specified loss.
The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles.
Relating to the intellect; a person possessing a highly developed intellect.
The ability to acquire and apply knowledge and skills.
Concentrated on a single area or subject or into a short time.
The action of interfering or the process of being interfered with.
Coming between two things in time, place, order, character, etc.
The action of explaining the meaning of something.
To ask questions of someone closely, aggressively, or formally.
To come between so as to prevent or alter a result or course of events.
Very complicated or detailed.
The action of introducing something.
The ability to understand something immediately, without the need for conscious reasoning.
Extremely useful; indispensable.
A complete list of items such as property, goods in stock, or the contents of a building.
A person who carries out a formal inquiry or investigation.
The action or process of investing money for profit or material result.
A written or verbal request inviting someone to go somewhere or to do something.
Done without will or conscious control.
Not logical or reasonable.
The supply of water to land or crops to help growth, typically by means of channels.
To put into a situation in which there is a danger of loss, harm, or failure.
Of, by, or appropriate to a court or judge.
The action of showing something to be right or reasonable.
A school or class for young children.
A room or building equipped for scientific experiments.
All the visible features of an area of countryside or land.
The legislative body of a country or state.
Conforming to the law or to rules.
The state of being responsible for something, especially by law.
A deputy or substitute acting for a superior; a military rank.
The state or fact of something's being likely; probability.
A limiting rule or circumstance; a restriction.
Written works, especially those considered of superior or lasting artistic merit.
A means of securing the necessities of life.
A particular place or position.
The angular distance of a place east or west of the meridian at Greenwich.
Producing a great deal of profit.
Impressively beautiful, elaborate, or extravagant.
The process of maintaining or preserving someone or something.
Characterized by malice; intending or intended to do harm.
Lack of proper nutrition.
Able to be managed, controlled, or accomplished without great difficulty.
Clear or obvious to the eye or mind.
To make something on a large scale using machinery.
A book, document, or piece of music written by hand.
Connected with the sea, especially in relation to seafaring commercial or military activity.
A feeling of pensive sadness, typically with no obvious cause.
A written message in business or diplomacy.
Goods to be bought and sold.
The chemical processes that occur within a living organism in order to maintain life.
Relating to or denoting a metropolis, often inclusive of its surrounding areas.
Seasonal movement of animals or people from one region to another.
A thing that is much smaller than normal, especially a small replica or model.
The smaller number or part, especially a number that is less than half the whole number.
Of various types or from different sources.
Causing or showing a fondness for causing trouble in a playful way.
A view or opinion that is incorrect because based on faulty thinking or understanding.
Bad luck; an unfortunate condition or event.
A form of government with a monarch at the head.
A legal agreement by which a bank lends money in exchange for taking title of the debtor's property.
Relating to a city or town or its governing body.
A spoken or written account of connected events; a story.
A person who strongly identifies with their own nation and vigorously supports its interests.
The process or activity of accurately ascertaining one's position and planning and following a route.
The fact of being required or indispensable.
Failure to take proper care in doing something.
To obtain or bring about by discussion.
A subatomic particle of about the same mass as a proton but without an electric charge.
A person who is proposed or formally entered as a candidate for an office.
A sentimental longing or wistful affection for the past.
Famous or well known, typically for some bad quality or deed.
A person, thing, or circumstance causing inconvenience or annoyance.
Relating to or expressed as a number or numbers.
The process of providing or obtaining the food necessary for health and growth.
An act or course of action to which a person is morally or legally bound; a duty.
The process of becoming obsolete or outdated and no longer used.
A thing that blocks one's way or prevents or hinders progress.
A job or profession; the action of occupying a place.
An incident or event.
Causing someone to feel deeply hurt, upset, or angry; actively aggressive.
Someone or something that has been left out or excluded.
Conceitedly assertive and dogmatic in one's opinions.
Someone who competes against or fights another in a contest, game, or argument.
A set of circumstances that makes it possible to do something.
Prolonged cruel or unjust treatment or control.
Hopefulness and confidence about the future or the successful outcome of something.
An individual animal, plant, or single-celled life form.
The determination of the relative position of something or someone.
Present or existing from the beginning; first or earliest.
Shockingly bad or excessive.
To form too high or favorable an estimate of.
A small booklet or leaflet containing information or arguments about a single subject.
An unbroken view of the whole region surrounding an observer.
A seemingly absurd or self-contradictory statement that may prove to be well founded or true.
A word, clause, or sentence inserted as an explanation or afterthought.
A person who takes part in something.
To succeed in forcing a way into or through.
The ability to see, hear, or become aware of something through the senses.
Musical instruments played by striking with the hand or with a handheld or pedal-operated stick or beater.
Lasting or existing for a long or apparently infinite time.
An act of staging or presenting a play, concert, or other form of entertainment.
Lasting or intended to last or remain unchanged forever.
Permitted; allowed.
Firm or obstinate continuance in a course of action in spite of difficulty or opposition.
A particular attitude toward or way of regarding something; a point of view.
The action or fact of persuading someone or of being persuaded to do or believe something.
Relevant or applicable to a particular matter.
A fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen, especially one whose cause is in question.
The study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.
The process by which green plants and some other organisms use sunlight to synthesize foods.
A person who is among the first to explore or settle a new country or area.
A large, thin, flat case for loose sheets of paper such as drawings or maps; a range of investments.
Occurring, awarded, or appearing after the death of the originator.
Having or showing the capacity to become or develop into something in the future.
A measure taken in advance to prevent something dangerous, unpleasant, or inconvenient from happening.
An earlier event or action that is regarded as an example or guide to be considered in subsequent similar circumstances.
The quality, condition, or fact of being exact and accurate.
Present as the strongest or main element.
Denoting an action or event preceding or doing in preparation for something fuller or more important.
A word governing, and usually preceding, a noun or pronoun and expressing a relation to another word.
Inspiring respect and admiration; having high status.
The fact or condition of being regarded or treated as more important.
The extent to which something is probable; the likelihood of something happening.
An established or official way of doing something.
A public or official announcement, especially one dealing with a matter of great importance.
A paid occupation, especially one that involves prolonged training and a formal qualification.
A high degree of competence or skill; expertise.
The action of forbidding something, especially by law.
An estimate or forecast of a future situation based on a study of present trends.
Important; famous; projecting from something.
Information, especially of a biased or misleading nature, used to promote a political cause or point of view.
A statement or assertion that expresses a judgment or opinion.
The state of being prosperous; financial success.
Having or showing a strong wish to keep someone or something safe from harm.
The official procedure or system of rules governing affairs of state or diplomatic occasions.
The action of providing or supplying something for use.
Nearness in space, time, or relationship.
The scientific study of the human mind and its functions.
The preparation and issuing of a book, journal, piece of music, or other work for public sale.
A small hole in a tire resulting in an escape of air.
A quality or accomplishment that makes someone suitable for a particular job or activity.
A state, period, or place of isolation in which people or animals that have arrived from elsewhere or been exposed to infectious or contagious disease are placed.
Trembling or shaking with a slight rapid motion.
The emission of energy as electromagnetic waves or as moving subatomic particles.
Having or showing a sensible and practical idea of what can be achieved or expected.
Say or do something to remove the doubts and fears of someone.
An act of violent or open resistance to an established government or ruler.
A written or printed statement acknowledging that something has been paid for or that goods have been received.
Go or move back or further away from a previous position.
Given, felt, or done in return.
The action or process of recognizing or being recognized, in particular.
A suggestion or proposal as to the best course of action, especially one put forward by an authoritative body.
Recover from illness or exertion.
A general vote by the electorate on a single political question that has been referred to them for a direct decision.
The throwing back by a body or surface of light, heat, or sound without absorbing it.
Stubborn or unmanageable.
Without paying attention to the present situation; despite the prevailing circumstances.
An official responsible for keeping a register or official records.
A rule or directive made and maintained by an authority.
Strengthen or support, especially with additional personnel or material.
Closely connected or appropriate to the matter at hand.
Unwilling and hesitant; disinclined.
The action of remembering something.
A revival of or renewed interest in something; the revival of art and literature under the influence of classical models in the 14th-16th centuries.
The action of renovating a building.
The action of repeating something that has already been said or written.
Typical of a class, group, or body of opinion; a person chosen to act or speak for others.
A large natural or artificial lake used as a source of water supply.
The refusal to accept or comply with something; the attempt to prevent something by action or argument.
A firm decision to do or not to do something.
The action of breathing.
The state or fact of having a duty to deal with something or of having control over someone.
A limiting condition or measure, especially a legal one.
Make an attack or assault in return for a similar attack.
The process of getting something back from somewhere.
A surprising and previously unknown fact, especially one that is made known in a dramatic way.
Deep respect for someone or something.
The action of revising.
The art of effective or persuasive speaking or writing.
Extremely thorough, exhaustive, or accurate.
A gambling game in which a ball is dropped onto a revolving wheel with numbered compartments.
Relating to the conditions that affect hygiene and health, especially the supply of sewage facilities and clean drinking water.
Cause something to become thoroughly soaked with liquid so that no more can be absorbed.
Causing general public outrage by a perceived offense against morality or law.
A plan for carrying out a process or procedure, giving lists of intended events and times.
Symbolic and simplified.
Academic study or achievement; learning of a high level; a grant or payment made to support a student's education.
Based on or characterized by the methods and principles of science.
Critical observation or examination.
A person employed by an individual or in an office to assist with correspondence, keep records, make appointments, and carry out similar tasks.
Matter that settles to the bottom of a liquid; dregs.
The action or state of setting someone or something apart from other people or things or being set apart.
A physical feeling or perception resulting from something that happens to or comes into contact with the body.
A particular order in which related events, movements, or things follow each other.
A noncommissioned officer in the armed forces or police.
Sufficiently great or important to be worthy of attention; noteworthy.
The dark shape and outline of someone or something visible against a lighter background, especially in dim light.
The state or fact of being similar.
A figure of speech involving the comparison of one thing with another thing of a different kind.
Occurring, operating, or done at the same time.
Not easily convinced; having doubts or reservations.
An act of speaking one's thoughts aloud when by oneself or regardless of any hearers, especially by a character in a play.
A thing that is kept as a reminder of a person, place, or event.
A supreme ruler, especially a monarch.
A person who watches at a show, game, or other event.
Performed or occurring as a result of a sudden inner impulse or inclination and without premeditation or external stimulus.
The process of making something physically more secure or stable.
Showing no activity; dull and sluggish; (of a body of water) having no current or flow and often having an unpleasant smell as a consequence.
A fact or piece of data from a study of a large quantity of numerical data.
A widely held but fixed and oversimplified image or idea of a particular type of person or thing.
A thing or event that evokes a specific functional reaction in an organ or tissue.
Relating to the identification of long-term or overall aims and interests and the means of achieving them.
The action or fact of accepting or yielding to a superior force or to the will or authority of another person.
Lower in rank or position.
Coming after something in time; following.
A particular kind of matter with uniform properties.
Of considerable importance, size, or worth.
Of or characteristic of a suburb.
Enough; adequate.
The right to vote in political elections.
The process of adding things together.
A person who manages or superintends an organization or activity.
Take the place of (a person or thing previously in authority or use); supplant.
Something that completes or enhances something else when added to it.
Forcibly put an end to.
A substitute, especially a person deputizing for another in a specific role or office.
Close observation, especially of a suspected spy or criminal.
The temporary prevention of something from continuing or being in force or effect.
A feeling or thought that something is possible, likely, or true.
A unit of pronunciation having one vowel sound, with or without surrounding consonants, forming the whole or a part of a word.
Made up of exactly similar parts facing each other or around an axis; showing symmetry.
A conference or meeting to discuss a particular subject.
A group of symptoms which consistently occur together, or a condition characterized by a set of associated symptoms.
The combination of ideas to form a theory or system.
Done or acting according to a fixed plan or system; methodical.
Relating to a particular subject, art, or craft, or its techniques.
The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry.
A person's or animal's nature, especially as it permanently affects their behavior.
Lasting for only a limited period of time; not permanent.
An inclination toward a particular characteristic or type of behavior.
Not certain or fixed; provisional.
Bring to an end.
A stretch of land, especially with regard to its physical features.
An area of land under the jurisdiction of a ruler or state.
A formal written or spoken statement, especially one given in a court of law.
Relating to the healing of disease.
A strip of wood, metal, or stone forming the bottom of a doorway and crossed in entering a house or room; a starting point.
The ability or willingness to tolerate something, in particular the existence of opinions or behavior that one does not necessarily agree with.
Relating to the arrangement of the physical features of an area.
A sporting competition in which contestants play a series of games to decide the winner.
The transmission of customs or beliefs from generation to generation, or the fact of being passed on in this way.
The path followed by a projectile flying or an object moving under the action of given forces.
Be or go beyond the range or limits of (something abstract, typically a conceptual field or division).
The process or a period of changing from one state or condition to another.
The action or process of transmitting something or the state of being transmitted.
Allowing light to pass through so that objects behind can be distinctly seen.

Very great in amount, scale, or intensity.
A court of justice.
A group of three related novels, plays, films, operas, or albums.
Having won a battle or contest; victorious.
Of little value or importance.
Violent or unsteady movement of air or water, or of some other fluid.
Having a wavelength shorter than that of the violet end of the visible spectrum but longer than that of X-rays.
Fully in agreement.
Not conscious.
Be a significant cause or basis of something if not necessarily manifest or obvious.
Erode the base or foundation of (a rock formation); damage or weaken (someone or something), especially gradually or insidiously.
Commit oneself to and begin (an enterprise or responsibility); take on.
Not changing in form or character; remaining the same in all cases and at all times.
Performed by or affecting only one person, group, or country involved in a particular situation, without the agreement of another or the others.
Of, affecting, or done by all people or things in the world or in a particular group; applicable to all cases.
Never done or known before.
Undo (twisted, knitted, or woven threads).
Designed to be useful or practical rather than attractive.
A spoken word, statement, or vocal sound.
An unoccupied position or job.
Treatment with a vaccine to produce immunity against a disease; inoculation.
A space entirely devoid of matter.
Check or prove the validity or accuracy of (something).
An estimation of something's worth, especially one carried out by a professional appraiser.
Not consistent or having a fixed pattern; liable to change.
A change or difference in condition, amount, or level, typically with certain limits.
Plants considered collectively, especially those found in a particular area or habitat.
The speed of something in a given direction.
Cause air to enter and circulate freely in (a room, building, etc.).
Relating to or in the form of words.
Make sure or demonstrate that something is true, accurate, or justified.
Able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities.
At right angles to a horizontal plane; in a direction, or having an alignment, such that the top is directly above the bottom.
A person who has had long experience in a particular field.
A constitutional right to reject a decision or proposal made by a law-making body.
The area near or surrounding a particular place.
A person harmed, injured, or killed as a result of a crime, accident, or other event or action.
A person's opinion or point of view.
Strong, healthy, and full of energy.
The action of violating someone or something.
Almost or nearly as described, but not completely or according to strict definition; generated by a computer.
Able to be seen.
Relating to seeing or sight.
The state of being strong and active; energy.
Utter (a sound or word).
A strong feeling of suitability for a particular career or occupation.
Liable to change rapidly and unpredictably, especially for the worse.
The amount of space that a substance or object occupies, or that is enclosed within a container.
Done, given, or acting of one's own free will.
Susceptible to physical or emotional attack or harm.

Using or expending something of value carelessly, extravagantly, or to no purpose.
The health, happiness, and fortunes of a person or group.
In contrast or comparison with the fact that.
The selling of goods in large quantities to be retailed by others.
An uncultivated, uninhabited, and inhospitable region.
The action of withdrawing something.
A person who sees an event, typically a crime or accident, take place.
Refuse to give (something that is due to or is desired by another).
Remain undamaged or unaffected by; resist.
The feeling or expression of reverence and adoration for a deity.
Having no real value or use.
Full of or characterized by intense anger.
In a very unhappy or unfortunate state.
Making twisting, squirming movements or contortions of the body.
Produce or provide (a natural, agricultural, or industrial product).
Having or showing zeal; passionate and dedicated.
The time at which something is most powerful or successful.
The scientific study of the behavior, structure, physiology, classification, and distribution of animals.
A departure from what is normal, usual, or expected, typically one that is unwelcome.
